actions.title: Securing the Southern Border and Border Wall

pushback.title: CASA v. Trump — Birthright Citizenship Challenge

weeks.summary: Day One: Trump signed a record-breaking flurry of executive orders — over 40 on inauguration day alone. Key actions included ending birthright citizenship, withdrawing from Paris and WHO, creating DOGE, rescinding 78 Biden EOs, pardoning Jan 6 participants, and declaring a border emergency. The ACLU filed immediately to block the birthright citizenship order.

actions.title: CDC Purges and Public Health Data Removal

pushback.title: Washington v. Trump — Birthright Citizenship Injunction

weeks.summary: Administration purged public health data from CDC and other federal websites. Secretary Rubio issued stop-work order freezing all foreign aid. Multiple states filed birthright citizenship challenges.

actions.title: Federal Employee 'Fork in the Road' Buyout

pushback.title: AFL-CIO v. DOGE — Data Access Challenge
NTEU v. CFPB — Consumer Bureau Dismantling
University of CA v. DOE — DOGE Data Access

weeks.summary: OPM issued 'fork in the road' buyout offers to all federal employees. First tariffs imposed. USAID began shutting down. Lawsuits mounted against DOGE data access, CFPB dismantling, and the USAID closure. Courts began blocking some actions while declining others.

pushback.title: NADOE v. Trump — DEI EOs Blocked
AP v. Trump — Press Pool Exclusion

weeks.summary: The administration escalated attacks on institutions: targeting Perkins Coie, Covington & Burling, and seizing control of the press pool. Judge Abelson issued a nationwide injunction blocking DEI EOs. 4,200 USAID employees placed on leave. Shockwaves through legal community as security clearances revoked. AP barred from Oval Office.

actions.title: Presidential Memo on Legal System Abuses
DOGE Workforce Optimization and Mass Firings

pushback.title: Global Health Council v. State — Foreign Aid Freeze
WilmerHale v. Trump — Law Firm EO
Jenner & Block v. Trump — Law Firm EO
California et al. v. DOE — Teacher Grants

weeks.summary: War on law firms escalated with EOs targeting WilmerHale, Jenner & Block, and Paul Weiss. Courts issued injunctions protecting the firms. Supreme Court restored foreign aid payment order 5-4. MSPB granted stays on mass firings at USDA. Legal challenges approached 130 cases. Trump attacked judges and called for impeachment of Chief Judge Boasberg.

The Alien Enemies Act was secretly signed on a Friday evening, with 250+ Venezuelans deported to CECOT in El Salvador over the weekend. Chief Judge Boasberg issued TROs but deportation flights were not turned back. Administration refused to provide flight details, invoking state secrets. Abrego Garcia wrongfully deported — DOJ admitted 'administrative error.' Constitutional crisis deepened.

pushback.title: CASA — Supreme Court Rules on Injunctions
Abrego Garcia — Supreme Court Orders Return
J.A.V. — Alien Enemies Act Ruled Illegal (Texas)

weeks.summary: Supreme Court issued landmark rulings: unanimously ordered Abrego Garcia returned, blocked deportations 7-2 in A.A.R.P. case. Trump-appointed Texas judge ruled the Alien Enemies Act invocation illegal. Judge Boasberg found probable cause for criminal contempt. Supreme Court in CASA limited nationwide injunctions 6-3 without ruling on birthright citizenship merits. Legal challenges exceeded 200.

pushback.title: New York v. McMahon — DOE Dismantling Blocked

weeks.summary: Administration pushed to defund CPB and dismantle the Department of Education. Judge Joun blocked Education dismantling, finding government's true intention was to eliminate the department without authorization. CPB sued over board terminations. Nearly 100 defense zone trespass charges dismissed in New Mexico. Supreme Court heard expedited birthright citizenship arguments.

Government attempted to deport noncitizens to third countries they had no connection to, including South Sudan. Judge Murphy found government acted 'unquestionably in violation' of court orders. Supreme Court stayed CHNV parole injunction 7-2, allowing termination of protections for 500,000+ people. Administration stonewalled in Abrego Garcia discovery.

pushback.title: J.G.G. — Boasberg Rules on CECOT Class
Abrego Garcia Returns to U.S., Charged

weeks.summary: Travel bans imposed on 12 countries with 36 more threatened. Harvard visa ban issued. Abrego Garcia returned after months of litigation, immediately charged with smuggling in apparent retaliation. Boasberg ruled on CECOT class due process violations, citing Kafka's 'The Trial.' CPSC commissioners won summary judgment. Violence Against Women Act grant conditions blocked.

pushback.title: CASA — Supreme Court Limits Nationwide Injunctions

weeks.summary: Supreme Court ruled 6-3 in CASA limiting nationwide injunctions without reaching birthright citizenship merits. Susman Godfrey won permanent injunction — court found EO 'violates the Constitution.' Erez Reuveni's whistleblower complaint revealed DOJ official suggested telling courts 'fuck you.' Supreme Court stayed third-country deportation injunction 6-3. Rescission package passed: $9 billion cut including $1.1B for CPB.

pushback.title: Ninth Circuit Affirms — Birthright EO Unconstitutional
DOE — Supreme Court Stays Dismantling Block 6-3
D.C. Circuit — Foreign Aid Impoundment Unlawful

weeks.summary: Despite CASA ruling, courts found new paths to block the birthright EO: nationwide class certifications and individual injunctions. Ninth Circuit became first appellate court to rule the EO unconstitutional. Supreme Court allowed CPSC firings and Education Department dismantling to proceed. D.C. Circuit ruled foreign aid impoundment violated the law. $9 billion rescission package passed.

pushback.title: D.C. Circuit Vacates Contempt — But Allows Proceedings

weeks.summary: D.C. Circuit vacated Boasberg's contempt finding 2-1 but allowed proceedings to continue. Judge Thompson blocked TPS terminations for Nepal, Honduras, and Nicaragua, finding DHS Secretary motivated by 'animus against immigrants.' State AGs from 23 states maintained pressure across multiple fronts. Trump attacked Goldman Sachs for economic predictions. Intel stake deal revealed as state capitalism.

Emergency deportation of Guatemalan children blocked at 4 AM after lawsuit filed at 1 AM. Fifth Circuit ruled 2-1 that the Alien Enemies Act was improperly invoked. H-1B visa fee of $100,000 imposed, splitting MAGA allies. Trump sued NYT for $15 billion — complaint struck as 'decidedly improper.' Multiple prosecutors forced out or fired for refusing to bring baseless charges.

pushback.title: U.S. Chamber v. Trump — H-1B Fee Challenge

weeks.summary: U.S. Chamber of Commerce filed its first challenge to the Trump administration over H-1B fees. Supreme Court accepted the birthright citizenship case on the merits. Administration facing 400+ active court cases. D.C. Circuit allowed Boasberg's contempt proceedings to continue. Multiple DOJ prosecutors resigned or fired over politically motivated prosecutions.

pushback.title: 22 States v. USDA — SNAP Payment Ordered
Trump v. CNN — Dismissed on Appeal
Full D.C. Circuit (8-3) — Contempt May Continue

weeks.summary: USDA suspended SNAP benefits for 42 million Americans. Courts ordered full payment, finding 'unjustifiable partisanship.' CBS News spiked 60 Minutes CECOT story under pressure. Trump v. CNN defamation suit dismissed. Full D.C. Circuit (8-3) allowed Boasberg's contempt proceedings to continue. Alien Enemies Act contempt hearings resumed with Reuveni testimony requested.

pushback.title: A.A.R.P. — Fifth Circuit En Banc Hearing

weeks.summary: Fifth Circuit heard en banc arguments on the Alien Enemies Act. Government's position that courts must defer to presidential invasion claims was challenged with the absurd 'Beatles British Invasion' hypothetical. Contempt proceedings continued over March deportation flights. Legal challenges exceeded 550 active cases.

Abrego Garcia granted habeas corpus and released from ICE custody. Judge cancelled his smuggling trial pending investigation into DOJ vindictiveness. Defense contractors EO imposed new restrictions on buybacks and executive pay. Fentanyl designated as WMD. Over 605,000 deported under Trump 2.0, 1.9 million left voluntarily. Visa suspension for 75 countries announced.

DOJ misconduct complaint against Judge Boasberg dismissed — no evidence of bias found. Trump sued JPMorgan Chase for $5 billion over debanking. As of January 15, 2026, Just Security tracks 582 active cases: 200 plaintiff wins, 110 government wins, 230 awaiting ruling. Over 100,000 visas revoked under Trump 2.0.
